com.pump.inspector

Interface InspectorLayout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InspectorGridBagLayout

    public interface InspectorLayout
    This interface adds GUI elements to an inspector.

    Currently this assumes the GUI is based in a left-to-right language, although it would not be too hard to change this in the future.

    Each row/separator is added in a top-to-bottom order.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGap()
      Appends a gap to this inspector.
      void addRow(javax.swing.JComponent component, int alignment, boolean stretchToFill)
      Appends a new row containing only 1 object to this inspector.

      Appends a new row containing 2 objects to this inspector.
      void addRow(javax.swing.JComponent identifier, javax.swing.JComponent leftControl, boolean stretchToFill, javax.swing.JComponent rightControl)
      Appends a new row containing 3 objects to this inspector.
      javax.swing.JSeparator addSeparator()

      void clear()
      Removes all elements from this inspector, usually so elements can be re-added.

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        void addRow(javax.swing.JComponent component,
            int alignment,
            boolean stretchToFill)
        Appends a new row containing only 1 object to this inspector.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to add.
        alignment - one of the SwingConstants values: LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT.
        stretchToFill - whether to stretch this component to fill the space horizontally or not.

      • addRow

        void addRow(javax.swing.JComponent identifier,
            javax.swing.JComponent control,
            boolean stretchControlToFill)
        Appends a new row containing 2 objects to this inspector. The identifier is right-aligned, and the control is left-aligned.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the control on the left. This should usually contain text. A JLabel or a JCheckBox is recommended.
        control - any more complex control on the right.
        stretchControlToFill - whether this control should stretch to fit the remaining width.

      • addRow

        void addRow(javax.swing.JComponent identifier,
            javax.swing.JComponent leftControl,
            boolean stretchToFill,
            javax.swing.JComponent rightControl)
        Appends a new row containing 3 objects to this inspector. The identifier is right-aligned. The leftControl is right-aligned, and the rightControl is right-aligned against the far right margin of the inspector.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the control on the left. This should usually contain text. A JLabel or a JCheckBox is recommended.
        leftControl - any other control.
        stretchToFill - whether the leftControl should stretch to fit the remaining width.
        rightControl - the element to add on the right.

      • addSeparator

        javax.swing.JSeparator addSeparator()
        Appends a new separator to this inspector.

      • addGap

        void addGap()
        Appends a gap to this inspector. All the rows should be their preferred/minimum height, but all vertical gaps will distribute the remaining vertical space evenly.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all elements from this inspector, usually so elements can be re-added.
